Pre-Game Insights: The Philadelphia Phillies face the Miami Marlins with a 2-1 series lead.
Philadelphia Phillies have an 85-57 record overall and a 38-32 record in road games.
Miami Marlins have a 53-89 record overall and a 27-47 record in home games.
The matchup Sunday is the 13th meeting between these teams this season. The Phillies have a 7-5 advantage in the season series.
Jake Burger leads Miami with 25 home runs while slugging .459.
Derek Hill is 6-for-34 with three home runs and six RBI over the last 10 games.
Kyle Schwarber has 20 doubles and 33 home runs for the Phillies.
Bryce Harper is 12-for-35 with four doubles over the last 10 games.
Marlins' last 10 games: 5-5, .251 batting average, 5.66 ERA, outscored by 17 runs.
Phillies' last 10 games: 7-3, .271 batting average, 4.15 ERA, outscored opponents by six runs.
Others: Pitching Probables: Phillies: Seth Johnson (0-0); Marlins: Edward Cabrera (3-6, 5.33 ERA, 1.47 WHIP, 84 strikeouts).
BETMGM SPORTSBOOK: LINE Phillies -129, Marlins +109; over/under is 8 1/2 runs.
